p: Clinical signs are evident between 22 and 36Â h postinfection and match with the peak of viral replication (Table 4.1). The clinical presentation (watery malabsorptive diarrhoea, vomiting, depression and anorexia) and pathological lesions of PEDV are clinically indistinguishable from those of TGEV (Debouck et al. 1981; Coussement et al. 1982).
